newsitem.title: FRANCE: French stocks open slightly higher.
newsitem.headline: French stocks open slightly higher.

text.p: French shares opened slightly higher on Friday after a big gain on Thursday on the back of surprise interest rate cuts in Germany and France, dealers said.
Shares were supported by a firmer Wall Street, bonds and franc but dealers said they expected resistance for the August CAC-40 future at 2,035.
The blue-chip CAC-40 index was up 3.76 points or 0.19 percent at 2,021.52 at 0817 GMT while the CAC-40 futures contract was up at 2,025.5 from 2,025 on Thursday's close.
"If the U.S. market will rise further today we could hold, otherwise we rise to see some declines due to profit-taking," a dealer said.
Volume was limited at 300 million francs.
Trade might become more lively this afternoon with U.S. July durable goods orders due at 1230 GMT.

Promodes was up 3.39 percent at 1,280 francs after the Les Echos newspaper reported the retailer could sell as soon as on Tuesday its German assets to Spar AG. A Promodes spokesman said the German dossier would be closed in early September or October. First half results are due on September 10.
